Package btp400.assignment1.backend

Class Admin

java.lang.Object
btp400.assignment1.backend.Admin
public class Admin extends Object
This class contains the methods that can be used for an admin in the library system. An admin can log into the system, register a librarian, delete a librarian, and view a list of currently registered librarians. This admin class can also read files containing admins and librarians, and can write files with info of librarians and list of librarians.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Nathaniel Ling

    • setFile

      public void setFile(String f)
      Setter function to set this.file to the value of the parameter.
      Parameters:
      f - String which this.file is set to.

    • login

      public String login(String usernameInput, String passwordInput)
      This method is used to validate the admin user by comparing the username and password entered by the user to the admin objects in the admins JSONArray. It iterates through the admins array and checks that both username input and password input have a match in the admins array. If there is a match, the iteration ends and this.loggedInAdmin is set to the username input and returns a success message. If there are no matches, it returns an error message.
      Parameters:
      usernameInput - String which is compared to the "username" key of the admin object.
      passwordInput - String which is compared to the "password" key of the admin object.
      Returns:
      String which indicates the success or error of the method.

    • libLogin

      public String libLogin(int userInputId, String userInputPassword)
      Method for testing librarian login purposes only
      Parameters:
      userInputId - Integer to compare against librarians "id" key
      userInputPassword - String to compare against librarians "password" key
      Returns:
      String which indicates the success of the method

    • registerLibrarian

      public String registerLibrarian(String libInputFname, String libInputLname, String libInputEmail, String libInputPassword)
      This method registers a new librarian to the system and writes the changes into the librarians.json file. It takes input from the user for fname, lname, email, and password, and generates an id using the generateId method. It restricts the symbols allowed for fname and lname to alphabetical symbols only. The email must follow a typical email format. If all the cases are passed, a new JSONObject is created to store the values entered by the user, along with the generated id, and adds it to the librarians JSONArray.
      Parameters:
      libInputFname - String which will set the first half of the value for the "name" key for the librarian object.
      libInputLname - String which will set the second half of the value for the "name" key for the librarian object.
      libInputEmail - String which will set the value for the "email" key for the librarian object. Also must be unique amongst other "email" keys in the librarians JSONArray.
      libInputPassword - String which will set the value for the "password" key for the librarian object.
      Returns:
      String value that indicates the success of the method.

    • deleteLibrarian

      public String deleteLibrarian(int inputId)
      This method deletes a librarian from the librarians JSONArray that has an id that matches the inputId from the user. If a match is found, the librarian object is removed from the librarians JSONArray.
      Parameters:
      inputId - Integer value which is compared against the "id" key of the librarian objects.
      Returns:
      String which indicates the success of the method.

    • viewLibrarians

      public org.json.simple.JSONArray viewLibrarians()
      This method accesses the librarians.json file using the setFile method and reads the data from the file using readDataFromFile method.
      Returns:
      JSONArray of librarians which holds the librarian JSONObjects.

    • setupLogger

      private Logger setupLogger()
      This method creates a Logger instance and FileHandler that stores the logs for exceptions that may occur in the adminLogger.txt file.
      Returns:
      Logger that can log information on logger files.

    • generateId

      private int generateId()
      This method generates a unique id for a librarian JSONObject based on the current number of librarians in the JSONArray.
      Returns:
      Integer which holds the value intended for the "id" key of the librarian JSONObject.

    • isValidEmailAddress

      private boolean isValidEmailAddress(String email)
      This method checks the format of the String to match a typical email format. e.g. this.example1@email.com would work, t@.his@email.ca.com would not work.
      Parameters:
      email - String to be checked for proper email formatting.
      Returns:
      boolean returns true if the email format is valid, else returns false.

    • readDataFromFile

      public void readDataFromFile(boolean admin)
      This method reads a file using FileReader and JSONParser to parse the data into an object. If the data to be read is a JSONArray of admins, this.admins JSONArray is set to the parsed data object. If it is a JSONArray of librarians, this.librarians JSONArray is set to the data. Any exceptions are logged by setupLogger method to the adminLogger.txt file.
      Parameters:
      admin - boolean which indicates whether the data should be admin or librarian.

    • writeDataToFile

      public void writeDataToFile()
      This method writes data to the file that this.file points to. The FileWriter writes the String returned by String.valueOf method of the JSONArray. Any exceptions are logged using setupLogger and are written to adminLogger.txt
